head.title: Knicks Beat Pacers Despite a New Injury

hedline.hl1: Knicks Beat Pacers Despite a New Injury

block.p: The Knicks, who began yesterday's game without the injured Patrick Ewing and then lost Marcus Camby to a knee injury, defeated the Indiana Pacers, 98-95, for their first victory in the N.B.A. Eastern Conference finals. The Pacers still lead the series, two games to one.
Ewing missed the game with a foot injury, and Camby was hurt in the second quarter. Their status is uncertain for tomorrow's game at Madison Square Garden.
